verses.verse: (For the choir director; on the Gittith. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.) How <WH4100> lovely <WH3039> are Thy dwelling <WH4908> places, <WH4908> O Lord <WH3068> of hosts! <WH6635>

My soul <WH5315> longed <WH3700> and even <WH1571> yearned <WH3615> for the courts <WH2691> of the Lord; <WH3068> My heart <WH3820> and my flesh <WH1320> sing <WH7442> for joy <WH7442> to the living <WH2416> God. <WH410>

The bird <WH6833> also <WH1571> has found <WH4672> a house, <WH1004> And the swallow <WH1866> a nest <WH7064> for herself, where <WH834> she may lay <WH7896> her young, <WH667> Even Thine altars, <WH4196> O Lord <WH3068> of hosts, <WH6635> My King <WH4428> and my God. <WH430>
How blessed <WH835> are those who dwell <WH3427> in Thy house! <WH1004> They are ever <WH5750> praising <WH1984> Thee. Selah. <WH5542>
How blessed <WH835> is the man <WH120> whose strength <WH5797> is in Thee; In whose heart <WH3824> are the highways <WH4546> [to Zion]!
Passing <WH5674> through the valley <WH6010> of Baca, <WH1056> they make <WH7896> it a spring, <WH4599> The early <WH9251> rain <WH9251> also <WH1571> covers <WH5844> it with blessings. <WH1293>
They go <WH1980> from strength <WH2428> to strength, <WH2428> [Every one of them] appears <WH7200> before <WH413> God <WH430> in Zion. <WH6726>
O Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> of hosts, <WH6635> hear <WH8085> my prayer; <WH8605> Give <WH238> ear, <WH238> O God <WH430> of Jacob! <WH3290> Selah. <WH5542>
Behold <WH7200> our shield, <WH4043> O God, <WH430> And look <WH5027> upon the face <WH6440> of Thine anointed. <WH4899>

For a day <WH3117> in Thy courts <WH2691> is better <WH2896> than <WH4480> a thousand <WH505> [outside.] I would rather stand <WH5605> at the threshold <WH5605> of the house <WH1004> of my God, <WH430> Than <WH4480> dwell <WH1752> in the tents <WH168> of wickedness. <WH7562>

For the Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> is a sun <WH8121> and shield; <WH4043> The Lord <WH3068> gives <WH5414> grace <WH2580> and glory; <WH9202> No <WH3808> good <WH9185> thing <WH9185> does He withhold <WH4513> from those who walk <WH1980> uprightly. <WH8549>
O Lord <WH3068> of hosts, <WH6635> How blessed <WH835> is the man <WH120> who trusts <WH982> in Thee!
